bug.author: LuposX
bug.summary: TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'precision'
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I followed the guide to "use 16bit precision" from the <denchmark-link:https://pytorch-lightning.readthedocs.io/en/latest/apex.html>documentation</denchmark-link>
But when I do: <denchmark-code>trainer = Trainer(amp_level='O1', precision=16, gpus=1) trainer.fit(model) </denchmark-code>
I get the error message: TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'precision' I am using lightning version: 0.6.0

comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!
Hi William, I am experiencing the same issue. I upgraded to master and the issue was not resolved.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/BradWyble>@BradWyble</denchmark-link> pls double check that you using master, e.g install from github pip install https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/archive/master.zip
pytorch-lightning/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py
Line 108 in bcb45d9
precision: int = 32,
